newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Selective buying gives Austria shares late boost.
newsitem.headline: Selective buying gives Austria shares late boost.

text.p: Austrian shares recovered from a weak start on Tuesday to end just 1.08 points lower and traders forecast the market would make a cautious advance over the next few days.
Vienna airport company Flughafen Wien and brickmaker Wienerberger led a recovery that took the ATX index of 21 blue-chip shares to a 1,174.99 points close from a session low of 1,163.97.
February ATX futures were three points down at 1,179.
"The recovery was all down to selective buying interest. People aren't buying the market but individual stocks," a trader said.
Market participants pointed to 1,200 points as a short-term target for the ATX index but noted it would first have to overcome a hurdle at 1,175.

Overall nine shares finished up and 12 down. Flughafen Wien was the biggest gainer, apparently buoyed by a big buy order from abroad. Its stock rose 33 schillings, or 6.19 percent, to 566 schillings on turnover of almost 140,000 lots.
Wienerberger, which will present its provisional 1996 results on Thursday, climbed 34 schillings to 2,185 on volume of 18,012.
Ordinary shares in bank Creditanstalt-Bankverein were the biggest decliner, down 15 schillings, or 2.15 percent, at 682 schillings.
The broad-based Vienna Bourse index slipped 0.96 points to 438.44 -- Vienna Newsroom, 43-1-53112-258
